summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Whereas many have undertaken to write a narrative of those things which are most surely believed among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as they were handed down to us by those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good to me also, having accurately investigated all things from the very beginning, to write to you an orderly account, most excellent Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you might know the certainty of the things which you have been told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zechariah, of the division of Abijah. And his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blamelessly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were now well advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while he served as priest before God, when his division was on duty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole crowd of people were praying outside at the hour of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zechariah saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to him, “Do not fear, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will turn many of the sons of Israel to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man and my wife well advanced in years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. And I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now you will be silent and unable to speak until the day that these things happen, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their season.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people waited for Zechariah, and wondered why he waited so long in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came out, he could not speak to them. They perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, for he made signs to them and remained speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After those days his wife Elizabeth conceived, and for five months she hid herself, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus the Lord has dealt with me in the days when He looked on me, to take away my reproach among men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. And the virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel came to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored. The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw him, she was troubled by his words, and considered in her mind what kind of greeting this might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Listen, you will conceive in your womb and bear a Son and shall call His name JESUS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Highest. And the Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and He will reign over the house of Jacob forever. And of His kingdom there will be no end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, since I do not know a man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Highest will overshadow you. Therefore the Holy One who will be born will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Listen, your cousin Elizabeth has also conceived a son in her old age. And this is the sixth month with her who was declared barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For with God nothing will be impossible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary said, “I am the servant of the Lord. May it be unto me according to your word.” Then the angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Mary arose and quickly went into the hill country, to a city of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby leaped in her womb. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She spoke out with a loud voice, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, as soon as the sound of your greeting came to my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a completion to those things which were told her by the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Mary said:
“My soul magnifies the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For He who is mighty has done great things for me,
    and holy is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His mercy is on those who fear Him
    from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown strength with His arm;
    He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has pulled down the mighty from their thrones
    and exalted those of low degree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled the hungry with good things,
    and the rich He has sent away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has helped His servant Israel,
    in remembrance of His mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as He spoke to our fathers,
    to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary remained with her about three months and returned to her own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elizabeth’s time had come to give birth, and she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and cousins heard how the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child. And they were calling him Zechariah, after the name of his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother answered, “Not so! He shall be called John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made signs to his father, asking what he would have him called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they all were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue was loosed, and he spoke and praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear came on all who lived around them. And all these facts were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, “What kind of child will he be?” For the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
    for He has visited and redeemed His people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and has raised up a horn of salvation for us
    in the house of His servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets of long ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that we should be saved from our enemies
    and from the hand of all who hate us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to perform the mercy promised to our fathers
    and to remember His holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the oath which He swore to our father Abraham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to grant us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies,
    might serve Him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest;
    for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give knowledge of salvation to His people
    by the remission of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
through the tender mercy of our God,
    whereby the sunrise from on high has visited us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give light to those who sit in darkness
    and in the shadow of death,
to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and he remained in the wilderness until the day of his appearance to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that the entire inhabited earth should be taxed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This taxation was first made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone went to his own city to be taxed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph also departed from the city of Nazareth in Galilee to the City of David which is called Bethlehem, in Judea, because he was of the house and lineage of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be taxed with Mary, his betrothed wife, who was with child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So while they were there, the day came for her to give birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she gave birth to her firstborn Son, and wrapped Him in strips of cloth, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same area there were shepherds living in the fields, keeping watch over their flock by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then an angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were very afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to them, “Listen! Do not fear. For I bring you good news of great joy, which will be to all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto you is born this day in the City of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will be a sign to you: You will find the Baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a manger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly there was with the angel a company of the heavenly host praising God and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Glory to God in the highest,
    and on earth peace, and good will toward men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said to each other, “Let us now go to Bethlehem and see what has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came hurrying and found Mary and Joseph, and the Baby lying in a manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had seen Him, they made widely known the word which was told them concerning this Child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those who heard it marveled at what the shepherds told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary kept all these things and pondered them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, as it had been told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When eight days had passed and the Child was circumcised, He was named JESUS, the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of her purification according to the Law of Moses were completed, they brought Him to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male shall be called holy to the Lord”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of the Lord, “a pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and this man was righteous and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Led by the Spirit, he came into the temple. And when the parents brought in the Child Jesus, to do for Him according to the custom of the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he received Him in his arms and blessed God and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Lord, now let Your servant depart in peace,
    according to Your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for my eyes have seen Your salvation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which You have prepared in the sight of all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a light for revelation to the Gentiles,
    and the glory of Your people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph and His mother were amazed at those things which were spoken about Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary His mother, “Listen, this Child is destined to cause the fall and rising of many in Israel and to be a sign which will be spoken against,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed. And a sword will pierce through your own soul also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Anna a prophetess, a daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was of a great age and had lived with her husband seven years from her virginity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she was a widow of about eighty-four years of age who did not depart from the temple, but served God with fasting and prayer night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming at that moment she gave thanks to the Lord and spoke of Him to all those who looked for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had performed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city of Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Child grew and became strong in spirit, filled with wisdom. And the grace of God was upon Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of the feast were complete, as they returned, the Child Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem. And Joseph and His mother did not know of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But supposing Him to be in their company, they went a day’s journey. Then they searched for Him among their relatives and acquaintances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem, searching for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and His answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw Him, they were amazed. And His mother said to Him, “Son, why have You dealt with us like this? Look, Your father and I have anxiously searched for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “How is it that you searched for Me? Did you not know that I must be about My Father’s business?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they did not understand the word which He spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He went down with them and came to Nazareth and was obedient to them. But His mother kept all these words in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature and in favor with God and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Caesar Tiberius, Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip was tetrarch of Iturea and the region of Traconitis, and Lysanias was the tetrarch of Abilene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came into the region surrounding the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, saying:
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord;
    make His paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “You children of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore bear fruit worthy of repentance, and do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say to you that God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the axe is put to the root of the trees. Every tree therefore which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people asked him, “What then must we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “He who has two tunics, let him give to him who has none. And he who has food, let him do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then tax collectors also came to be baptized and said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Collect no more than what is appointed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the soldiers likewise demanded of him, “And what must we do?”
He said to them, “Do no violence to anyone nor accuse any falsely, and be content with your wages.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the people were in expectation, and everyone reflected in their hearts upon John, whether he might be the Christ or not,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water. But One mightier than I is coming, the strings of whose shoes I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly cleanse His threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into His granary. But He will burn the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he preached many other things in his exhortation to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Herod the tetrarch, being rebuked by him because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: added also this above them all: He locked John up in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the people were baptized, and when Jesus also had been baptized and was praying, the heavens were opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on Him, and a voice came from heaven which said, “You are My beloved Son. In You I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jesus Himself began His ministry at about thirty years of age, being, as was supposed, the son of Joseph,
who was the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Matthat,
who was the son of Levi, who was the son of Melchi,
who was the son of Jannai, who was the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Mattathias, who was the son of Amos,
who was the son of Nahum, who was the son of Esli,
who was the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Maath,
who was the son of Mattathias, who was the son of Semein,
who was the son of Josech, who was the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Joanan, who was the son of Rhesa,
who was the son of Zerubbabel, who was the son of Shealtiel,
who was the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Melchi,
who was the son of Addi, who was the son of Cosam,
who was the son of Elmadam, who was the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Joshua, who was the son of Eliezer,
who was the son of Jorim, who was the son of Matthat,
who was the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Simeon,
who was the son of Judah, who was the son of Joseph,
who was the son of Jonan, who was the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Melea, who was the son of Menna,
who was the son of Mattatha, who was the son of Nathan,
who was the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Jesse,
who was the son of Obed, who was the son of Boaz,
who was the son of Salmon, who was the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Amminadab, who was the son of Ram,
who was the son of Hezron, who was the son of Perez,
who was the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Jacob,
who was the son of Isaac, who was the son of Abraham,
who was the son of Terah, who was the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Serug, who was the son of Reu,
who was the son of Peleg, who was the son of Eber,
who was the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Cainan,
who was the son of Arphaxad, who was the son of Shem,
who was the son of Noah, who was the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Methuselah, who was the son of Enoch,
who was the son of Jared, who was the son of Mahalalel,
who was the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who was the son of Enosh,
who was the son of Seth, who was the son of Adam,
who was the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being tempted by the devil for forty days. During those days He ate nothing. And when they were ended, He was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The devil, taking Him up onto a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the devil said to Him, “I will give You all this power and their glory, for it has been delivered to me. And I give it to whomever I will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If You, then, will worship me, all will be Yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered him, “Get behind Me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only shall you serve.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He brought Him to Jerusalem, set Him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written:
‘He shall give His angels charge concerning you,
    to preserve you,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and
‘In their hands they shall hold you up,
    lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the devil had ended all the temptations, he departed from Him until another time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee. And His fame went throughout the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went to the synagogue on the Sabbath day. And He stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to Him. When He had unrolled the scroll, He found the place where it was written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me,
    because He has anointed Me
    to preach the gospel to the poor;
He has sent Me to heal the broken-hearted,
    to preach deliverance to the captives
    and recovery of sight to the blind,
to set at liberty those who are oppressed;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: to preach the acceptable year of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He rolled up the scroll, and He gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all those who were in the synagogue were fixed on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He began to say to them, “Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All bore witness to Him, and wondered at the gracious words which came from His mouth. Then they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You will surely say to Me this proverb, ‘Physician, heal Yourself. Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’ ”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He also said, “Truly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you truthfully, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heavens were closed for three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yet to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, a city of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet. But none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They rose up and thrust Him out of the city and led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down headlong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But passing through the midst of them, He went His way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were astonished at His teaching, for His word was with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon. And he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Leave us alone! What have You to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!” When the demon had thrown him down in their midst, he came out of him and did not hurt him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They were all amazed and said among themselves, “What a word this is! For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits, and they come out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His fame went out to every place in the surrounding countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out of the synagogue and entered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was taken ill with a high fever, and they asked Him about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she rose and served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the sun was setting, all those who had anyone sick with various diseases brought them to Him. And He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And demons came out of many, crying out, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” But He rebuked them and did not permit them to speak, because they knew that He was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When it was day He departed and went into a remote place. And searching for Him, the people came to Him and tried to prevent Him from leaving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also, for this is why I was sent.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the people pressed upon Him to hear the word of God, He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw two boats beside the lake. But the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to thrust it out a little from the land. Then He sat down and taught the people from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered Him, “Master, we have worked all night and have caught nothing. But at Your word I will let down the net.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was tearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish which they had taken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon.
Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not fear. From now on you will catch men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had brought their boats to land, they left everything and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was in a certain city, a man full of leprosy, upon seeing Jesus, fell on his face and begged Him, “Lord, if You will, You can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He reached out His hand and touched him, saying, “I will. Be clean.” And immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He commanded him to tell no one, “But go and show yourself to the priest and make an offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even more so His fame went everywhere. And great crowds came together to hear and to be healed by Him of their infirmities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He withdrew to the wilderness and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On a certain day, as He was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting nearby, who had come from every town of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some men brought in a bed a man who was paralyzed. They searched for ways to bring him in and lay him before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not find a way to bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down through the tiles with his bed into their midst before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He saw their faith, He said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees began to question, “Who is He who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus perceived their thoughts, He answered them, “Why question in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” He said to the paralyzed man, “I say to you, rise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he rose before them, and took up that on which he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen wonderful things today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things He went out and saw a tax collector, named Levi, sitting at the tax collector’s station. He said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left everything, rose up, and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Levi made Him a great feast in his house. And there was a group of many tax collectors and others who sat down with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against His disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Those who are well do not need a physician, but those who are sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John fast often and offer prayers, and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees, but Yours eat and drink?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Can you make the attendants of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then in those days they will fast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them a parable also: “No one sews a piece of a new material on an old one. Otherwise the new would tear, for the new piece does not match the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the new wine will burst the wineskins, and it will be spilled, and the wineskins will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But new wine must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one, having drunk old wine, immediately desires new. For he says, ‘The old is better.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second Sabbath after the first, He went through the grain fields, and His disciples plucked and ate the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have you not read what David did when he and those who were with him were hungry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the house of God, and took and ate the ritual bread, and also gave it to those who were with him. This was not lawful, but for the priests only to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another Sabbath, when He entered the synagogue and taught, there was a man whose right hand had withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees watched Him to see whether He would heal on the Sabbath, so that they might find an accusation against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He knew their thoughts, and He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise and stand in front.” So he rose and stood in front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then looking around at them all, He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did so, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were filled with madness and discussed with each other what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these days He went out to the mountain to pray and continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was day, He called for His disciples, and of them He chose twelve, whom He named apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, whom He named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Matthew and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciples and a great crowd of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: including those who were vexed by unclean spirits. And they were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole crowd tried to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lifted up His eyes on His disciples, and said:
“Blessed are you poor,
    for yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you who hunger now,
    for you shall be filled.
Blessed are you who weep now,
    for you shall laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you when men hate you,
    and when they separate you from their company and insult you,
    and cast out your name as evil,
        on account of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for indeed, your reward is great in heaven. For in like manner their fathers treated the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But woe to you who are rich,
    for you have received your consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you who are filled,
    for you shall hunger.
Woe to you who laugh now,
    for you shall mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, when all men speak well of you,
    for so their fathers spoke of the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I say to you who hear, love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who spitefully use you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him who strikes you on the one cheek, offer also the other. And from him who takes away your cloak, do not withhold your tunic as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks of you. And of him who takes away your goods, do not ask for them back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do unto others as you would have others do unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For if you love those who love you, what thanks do you receive? For even sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what thanks do you receive? For even sinners do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what thanks do you receive? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive as much in return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return. Then your reward will be great, and you will be the sons of the Highest. For He is kind to the unthankful and the evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be therefore merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Judge not, and you shall not be judged. Condemn not, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you shall be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and it will be given to you: Good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over will men give unto you. For with the measure you use, it will be measured unto you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke a parable to them: “Can the blind lead the blind? Will they not both fall into the ditch?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not see the beam that is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A good tree does not bear corrupt fruit, nor does a corrupt tree bear good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each tree is known by its own fruit. Men do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a wild bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bears what is good, and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bears what is evil. For of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and not do what I say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever comes to Me and hears My words and does them, I will show whom he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a man who built a house, and dug deep, and laid the foundation on rock. When the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently against that house, but could not shake it, for it was founded on rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who hears and does not obey is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation, against which the stream beat vehemently. Immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had completed all His words in the hearing of the people, He entered Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and ready to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard of Jesus, he sent the elders of the Jews to Him, asking Him to come and heal his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they asked Him earnestly, saying, “You should do this for him for he is worthy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he loves our nation, and he has built us a synagogue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Jesus went with them.
When He was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself, for I am not worthy to have You come under my roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, I did not think myself worthy to come to You. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I myself am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard these words, He marveled at him, and turned and said to the people who followed Him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith even in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who were sent, returning to the house, found the servant well who had been sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following day He went into a city called Nain, and many of His disciples and a large crowd went with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came near the gate of the city, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the city was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her and said to her, “Do not weep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came and touched the coffin, and those who carried it stood still. He said, “Young man, I say to you, arise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who was dead sat up and began to speak. And He gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear came on everyone. And they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has risen up among us!” and “God has visited His people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This rumor of Him went throughout all Judea and the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples of John told him of all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John, calling for two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are You the One who is coming, or shall we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men had come to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, saying, ‘Are You the One who is coming, or shall we look for another?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same hour He cured many of their infirmities and afflictions and evil spirits. And to many who were blind He gave sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you have seen and heard: that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the gospel is preached to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is he who does not fall away on account of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the crowd concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? Now those who are splendidly clothed and live luxuriously are in royal palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is he of whom it is written:
‘Look, I am sending My messenger before Your face,
    who shall prepare Your way before You.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, among those who are born of women there is no greater prophet than John the Baptist. Yet he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people who heard Him, including the tax collectors, justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God for themselves, not having been baptized by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “To what then shall I compare the men of this generation, and what are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like children sitting in the marketplace, calling to each other, saying:
‘We played the flute for you,
    and you did not dance;
we mourned to you,
    and you did not weep.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine. But you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking. But you say, ‘Look, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But wisdom is justified by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him. So He went to the Pharisee’s house and sat down for supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There, a woman of the city who was a sinner, when she learned that Jesus was sitting for supper in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and stood behind Him at His feet, weeping, and began to wash His feet with tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed His feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw it, he said to himself, “If this Man were a prophet, He would have known who and what kind of woman she is who is touching Him, for she is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.”
He said, “Teacher, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A creditor had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had no money to pay, he freely forgave them both. Tell Me, therefore, which of them will love him more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon answered, “I suppose he whom he forgave more.”
He said to him, “You have judged rightly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house. You gave Me no water for My feet, but she has washed My feet with her tears and wiped them with the hair of her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave Me no kiss, but this woman, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss My feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not anoint My head with oil, but this woman has anointed My feet with ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say to you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But he who is forgiven little loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who sat at supper with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is He who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, He went throughout every city and village, preaching and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God. With Him were the twelve
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and some women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had come out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who supported Him with their possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a large crowd had gathered together and people were coming to Him from every city, He told this parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A sower went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled down, and the birds of the air devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some fell on a rock. And as soon as it sprang up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet some fell among thorns. And the thorns sprang up with it and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And other seed fell on good ground and sprang up and yielded a hundred times the amount sown.”
When He had said these things, He cried out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked Him, “What might this parable mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but to others they are in parables, so that
‘seeing they may not see,
    and hearing they may not understand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the parable means this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those along the path are those who hear. Then comes the devil, who takes away the word from their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those on the rock are the ones who, when they hear the word, receive it with joy. But these have no root, for they believe for a while, then in the time of temptation fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which fell among thorns are those who, when they have heard, go out and are choked with the cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to maturity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the seed on the good ground are those who, having heard the word, keep it in an honest and good heart and bear fruit with patience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one, when he lights a candle, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but sets it on a candlestick, that those who enter may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is secret that will not be revealed, nor anything hidden that will not be known and revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given. And whoever has not, from him will be taken even what he thinks he has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His mother and His brothers came to Him, but could not reach Him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone told Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day He went into a boat with His disciples, and He said to them, “Let us go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they sailed, He fell asleep. Then a wind storm came down on the lake, and they were filling with water, and were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!”
Then He arose and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water. And they ceased, and there was a calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “Where is your faith?”
Being afraid, they marveled, saying to each other, “Who then is this Man? He commands even the winds and water, and they obey Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sailed to the country of the Gadarenes, which is across from Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He stepped out on land, a man from the city who had demons for a long time met Him. He wore no clothes, nor did he live in a house but in the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, “What have You to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I plead with You, do not torment me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. It often had seized him, and he was kept under guard, bound with chains and shackles. But he broke the shackles and was driven by the demon into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”
He said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they begged Him not to command them to go out into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a large herd of swine feeding on the mountain. They begged Him to permit them to enter them, and He permitted them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the demons went out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd ran violently down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and reported it in the city and in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had departed sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole crowd from the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked Him to depart from them, for they were seized with great fear. So He went into the boat and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the man from whom the demons had departed asked Him if he could stay with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your own house, and tell what great things God has done for you.” So he went his way and proclaimed throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus returned, the crowd gladly received Him, for they were all waiting for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man named Jairus, who was a ruler of the synagogue, came and fell down at Jesus’ feet, and begged Him to come to his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying.
As He went, the people crowded Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman having a hemorrhage for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians, but could not be healed by anyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came behind Him, and touched the fringe of His garment. And immediately her hemorrhage dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Who touched Me?”
When everyone denied it, Peter and those who were with Him said, “Master, the crowds are pressing against You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone touched Me, for I perceive that power has gone out from Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling. And falling down before Him, she declared to Him before all the people why she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to her, “Daughter, be of good cheer. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was still speaking, someone from the synagogue ruler’s house came, saying to Jairus, “Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard it, He answered him, “Do not fear. Only believe, and she will be made well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came into the house, He permitted no one to go in except Peter, John and James, and the father and mother of the girl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All wept and mourned for her. But He said, “Do not weep. She is not dead but sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed at Him, knowing that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He put them all outside and took her by the hand and called, saying, “Little girl, arise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He told them to give her food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her parents were astonished, but He commanded them to tell no one what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey: no staff, no bag, no bread, no money. And do not take two tunics apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever house you enter, stay there, and from there depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they departed and went through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by Him. And he was perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Herod said, “I have beheaded John. But who is this of whom I hear such things?” And he tried to see Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the apostles returned, they told Jesus all that they had done. Then He took them and went aside privately into a deserted place belonging to the city called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowds knew it, they followed Him. And He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day began to end, the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the crowds away, so they can go into the towns and surrounding countryside and lodge and get food. For we are in a deserted place here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “You give them something to eat.”
They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There were about five thousand men.
But He said to His disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of fifty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did so, and made them all sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled, and twelve baskets of broken pieces that remained were collected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He was alone praying, His disciples were with Him. And He asked them, “Who do the people say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “John the Baptist. But some say Elijah. And others say that one of the old prophets has risen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus strictly commanded them to tell no one of this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them all, “If anyone will come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever will save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, yet loses or forfeits himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed when He comes in His own glory and in the glory of His Father and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I tell you truly, there are some standing here who shall not taste death before they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About eight days after these sayings, He took Peter and John and James and went up onto a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He prayed, the appearance of His countenance was altered, and His clothing was white and glistening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly two men were talking with Him, who were Moses and Elijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who appeared in glory and spoke of His departure which He was to accomplish in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep. But waking thoroughly, they saw His glory and the two men who stood with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they departed from Him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three sanctuaries: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was speaking, a cloud came and overshadowed them. And they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came from out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Listen to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. They kept silent and told no one in those days anything they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a great crowd met Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly a man cried out from the crowd, saying, “Teacher, I beg You, look upon my son, for he is my only child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out. It convulses him until he foams at the mouth, and bruises him, and scarcely leaves him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and returned him to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God.
But while everyone marveled at all the things Jesus did, He said to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let these words sink down into your ears, for the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand this statement, and it was hidden from them, so that they did not perceive it. And they were afraid to ask Him about this statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dispute arose among them as to which of them was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child and put him by Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Whoever receives this child in My name receives Me, and whoever receives Me receives Him who sent Me. For he who is least among you all will be great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “Master, we saw a man casting out demons in Your name and we forbade him, because he does not follow with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Do not forbid him, for he who is not against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came for Him to be received up, He was steadfastly set to go to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent messengers ahead of Him. They went and entered a village of the Samaritans to make things ready for Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they did not receive Him, because He was set to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When His disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them, even as Elijah did?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He turned and rebuked them and said, “You do not know what kind of spirit you are of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives but to save them.” And they went to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went along the way, a man said to Him, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests. But the Son of Man has no place to lay His head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to another man, “Follow Me.”
But he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead. But you go and preach the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet another said, “Lord, I will follow You, but let me first go bid farewell to those at my house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back at things is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this the Lord appointed seventy others, and sent them two by two ahead of Him into every city and place where He Himself was about to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your ways. Listen, I am sending you out as lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carry no purse, no bag, no shoes, and greet no one on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you enter a house, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest upon him; but if not, it will return upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in the same house, eating and drinking what they give, for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Do not go from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you enter a city and they receive you, eat what is set before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick who are there and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you enter a city and they do not receive you, go your way out into their streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Even the dust of your city which clings to us, we wipe off against you. Yet be sure of this, that the kingdom of God has come near to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, it will be more tolerable on that Day for Sodom than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which have been done for you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? You will be thrust down to hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who listens to you listens to Me, he who rejects you rejects Me, and he who rejects Me rejects Him who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us through Your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I saw Satan as lightning fall from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I give you authority to trample on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. And nothing shall by any means hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless do not rejoice that the spirits are subject to you, but rather rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I thank You, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because You have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent and revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, for it was Your good pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All things have been handed over to Me by My Father. And no one knows who the Son is but the Father, and who the Father is but the Son and he to whom the Son desires to reveal Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He turned to His disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see what you see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, many prophets and kings have desired to see what you see, and have not seen it, and to hear what you hear, and have not heard it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, a lawyer stood up and tested Him, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you read?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “ ‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind’ and ‘your neighbor as yourself.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “A man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell among thieves, who stripped him of his clothing and wounded him and departed, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By chance a priest came down that way. And when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise a Levite, when he came to that place, looked at him and passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was. And when he saw him, he had compassion on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and went to him and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine. Then he set him on his own donkey and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day when he departed, he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper and said to him, ‘Take care of him. I will repay you whatever else you spend when I return.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now which of these three do you think was a neighbor to him who fell among the thieves?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “The one who showed mercy on him.”
Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went, He entered a village. And a woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and listened to His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came to Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Then tell her to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one thing is needed. And Mary has chosen the good part, which shall not be taken from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was praying in a certain place, and when He ceased, one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “When you pray, say:
Our Father, who is in heaven,
hallowed be Your name.
Your kingdom come;
Your will be done
    on earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us each day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And forgive us our sins,
    for we also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.
And lead us not into temptation,
    but deliver us from evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Which of you has a friend and shall go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a friend of mine on his journey has come to me, and I have nothing to set before him’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will answer from within, ‘Do not trouble me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give you anything’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, though he will not rise and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence he will rise and give him as much as he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I tell you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a son asks for bread from any of you who is a father, will you give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will you give him a serpent instead of a fish?
