verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, will you offer him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke, and the crowd marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “He casts out demons through Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, testing Him, asked Him for a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is made desolate. And a house divided against itself falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons through Beelzebub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out demons with the finger of God, no doubt the kingdom of God has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are peacefully kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when a stronger man than he attacks and overpowers him, he seizes all the armor in which the man trusted and divides his spoils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, it goes through dry places seeking rest. Finding none, it says, ‘I will return to my house, from which I came.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it comes, it finds it swept and furnished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they enter and dwell there. And the last state of that man is worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spoke these things, a woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the woman who gave You birth and nursed You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said, “Indeed, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds pressed upon Him, He began to say, “This is an evil generation. It looks for a sign, but no sign will be given it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of Man be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. And now one greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah. And now one greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one, when he has lit a candle, puts it in a secret place or under a basket, but on a candlestick, that those who come in may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye is the lamp of the body. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body also is full of light. But when your eye is bad, your body also is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed therefore lest the light which is in you is darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your whole body, then, is full of light, no part being dark, the whole body will be full of light, as when the shining candle gives you light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spoke, a Pharisee asked Him to dine with him. So He went in and sat down to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that He had not first washed before dinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the dish. But inside you are full of extortion and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools! Did not he who made the outside make the inside also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give alms from what is within. And then all things are clean to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb and pass over justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Pharisees! For you love the prominent seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like unseen graves, and the men who walk over them are not aware of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the lawyers answered, “Teacher, by saying these things You insult us also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Woe to you also, you lawyers! For you load men with burdens difficult to carry, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are witnesses and entirely approve the deeds of your fathers, because they killed them, and you build their tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the blood of all the prophets, shed since the beginning of the world, may be required from this generation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it shall be required from this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter yourselves, and you hindered those who were entering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to incite Him vehemently and angrily draw Him out concerning many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lying in wait for Him and seeking to catch something out of His mouth, that they might accuse Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, when thousands of the crowd were assembled, so as to trample on one another, He began to say to His disciples first, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore what you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. And what you have whispered in the ear in private rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that can do no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will warn you whom you shall fear: Fear Him who, after He has killed, has power to cast into hell. Yes, I say to you, fear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Therefore do not fear. You are more valuable than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I say to you, whoever confesses Me before men, him will the Son of Man also confess before the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who denies Me before men will be denied before the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When they bring you to the synagogues, rulers, and authorities, do not be anxious how you will answer or what you will say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone in the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Man, who appointed Me a judge or an arbitrator between you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Take heed and beware of covetousness. For a man’s life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He told a parable to them, saying, “The land of a rich man produced plentifully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He thought to himself, ‘What shall I do, for I have no room to store my crops?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he said, ‘This I will do: I will pull down my barns and build greater ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to my soul, Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take rest. Eat, drink, and be merry.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But God said to him, ‘You fool! This night your soul will be required of you. Then whose will those things be which you have provided?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So is he who stores up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to His disciples, “Therefore I say to you, do not be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor for your body, what you will wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens: They neither sow nor reap, they have neither storehouses nor barns. Yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who of you by worrying can add one cubit to his height?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then cannot do what is least, why are you anxious about the other things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Consider how the lilies grow. They neither spin nor weave. Yet I say to you that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God so clothes the grass, which today is in the field and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not seek what you will eat or what you will drink, nor be of an anxious mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the nations of the world seek all these things, and your Father knows that you need them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seek the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell your possessions and give alms. Provide yourselves purses that do not grow old, an unfailing treasure in the heavens, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let your waist be girded and your lights be burning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you be like men waiting for their master to return from the wedding banquet, so that they may open the door immediately for him when he comes and knocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants whom the master will find watching when he comes. Truly I say to you, he will dress himself and have them sit down to dine, and he will come and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes in the second watch, or comes in the third watch, and finds them so, blessed are those servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched and not have allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You telling this parable to us, or to everyone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his master will make ruler over his house servants, to give them their portion of food at the proper time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I say to you, he will appoint him over all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the house servants, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not look for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him to pieces and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That servant who knew his master’s will, but did not prepare himself or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who unknowingly committed acts worthy of punishment shall be beaten with few stripes. For to whom much is given, of him much shall be required. And from him to whom much was entrusted, much will be asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have come to send fire upon the earth and wish that it were already kindled!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how pressed I am until it is accomplished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you suppose that I have come to give peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there will be from now on five divided in one house, three against two and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, and mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the crowd: “When you see a cloud rise out of the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be heat,’ and it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! You can discern the face of the sky and of the earth. But why do you not know how to discern this time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why even among yourselves do you not judge what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go with your adversary to the magistrate, as you are on the way, diligently try to settle matters with him, lest he drag you to the judge, and the judge will hand you over to the officer, and the officer will throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you shall not come out from there until you have paid the very last penny.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were present at that time some who told Him of the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Do you suppose that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them, do you think that they were worse offenders than all men living in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He told this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came and looked for fruit on it and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to the vinedresser of his vineyard, ‘Now these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and I find none. Cut it down. Why should it deplete the soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He answered him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it bears fruit, well. But if not, after that you shall cut it down.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years and was bent over and could not straighten herself up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, He called her and said to her, “Woman, you are loosed from your infirmity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He laid His hands on her, and immediately she was made straight and glorified God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, and said to the people, “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come and be healed on those days, but not on the Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord answered him, “You hypocrite! Does not each one of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from the stall and lead it away to water it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then should not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has bound these eighteen years, be loosed from this bondage on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He said this, all His adversaries were ashamed. And all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said, “What is the kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in sixty pounds of meal until all of it was leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Someone said to Him, “Lord, will those who are saved be few?”
He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Strive to enter through the narrow gate. For many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once the Master of the house has risen up and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open for us,’ He will answer you, ‘I do not know where you come from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But He will say, ‘I tell you, I do not know you, or where you come from. Depart from Me, all you workers of iniquity.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come from the east and from the west and from the north and from the south and will sit down to dine in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, there are the last who will be first, and the first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same day certain Pharisees came, saying to Him, “Get out and depart from here, for Herod wants to kill You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Look, I cast out demons. And I perform healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I shall be perfected.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I must travel today and tomorrow and the day following. For it cannot be that a prophet should perish outside Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to you! How often would I have gathered your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, your house is forsaken. Truly I say to you, you shall not see Me until the time comes when you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the Sabbath they watched Him as He went into the house of one of the leaders of the Pharisees to eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There before Him was a man who had edema.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the lawyers and Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they remained silent. So He took him and healed him, and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said, “Which of you having a donkey or an ox that has fallen into a pit will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they could not answer Him regarding these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He marked how they chose the seats of honor, He told a parable to those who were invited, saying to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by any man to a wedding banquet, do not sit down in a seat of honor, lest a more honorable man than you be invited by him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who invited you both will come and say to you, ‘Give this man the seat,’ and then you will begin with shame to take the lowest seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and sit down in the lowest seat, so that when he who invited you comes, he may say to you, ‘Friend, go up higher.’ Then you will have respect in the presence of those who sit at dinner with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said also to the one who invited Him, “When you prepare a dinner or a supper, do not call your friends or your brothers or your kinsmen or your rich neighbors, lest they also invite you in return, and you be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you prepare a banquet, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will be blessed, for they cannot repay you. You shall be repaid at the resurrection of the just.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of those who sat at dinner with Him heard this, he said to Him, “Blessed is he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to him, “A man prepared a banquet and invited many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent his servant at supper time to say to those who had been invited, ‘Come, for everything is now prepared.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But they all with one mind began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a piece of land, and I must go and see it. I ask you to excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to prove them. I ask you to excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Still another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant came and reported this to his master. Then the master of the house in anger said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in here the poor and the maimed and the lame and the blind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant said, ‘Master, what you commanded has been done, and yet there is room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, so that my house may be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, none of those men who were invited shall taste my supper.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds went with Him. And He turned and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, yes, and even his own life, he cannot be My disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever does not bear his cross and follow Me cannot be My disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For who among you, intending to build a tower, does not sit down first and count the cost to see whether he has resources to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, perhaps, after he has laid the foundation and is not able to complete it, all who see it will begin to mock him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to complete it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or what king, going to wage war against another king, does not sit down first and take counsel whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, while the other is yet at a distance, he sends a delegation and requests conditions of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise, any of you who does not forsake all that he has cannot be My disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good. But if the salt has lost its saltiness, how shall it be made salty?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is fit neither for the land nor for the manure pile. So men throw it out.
“He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners drew near to Him to hear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, “This Man receives sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He told them this parable, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What man among you having a hundred sheep and losing one of them does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the one which is lost until he finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he has found it, he places it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous men who need no repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or what woman, having ten silver coins and losing one, does not light a candle and sweep the house and search diligently until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin which I had lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said, “A man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the property that falls to me.’ So he divided his estate between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Not many days later, the younger son gathered everything together, and journeyed to a distant country, and there squandered his possessions in prodigal living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had spent everything, there came a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and hired himself to a citizen of that county, who sent him into his fields to feed swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would gladly have filled his stomach with the husks that the swine were eating, but no one gave him any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have an abundance of bread, and here I am perishing with hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will arise and go to my father, and I will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he arose and came to his father.
“But while he was yet far away, his father saw him and was moved with compassion, and ran and embraced his neck and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe and put it on him. And put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring here the fattened calf and kill it, and let us eat and be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this son of mine was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.’ So they began to be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now his older son was in the field. As he came and drew near the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called one of the servants and asked what this meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him safe and sound.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He was angry and would not go in. Therefore his father came out and entreated him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered his father, ‘Look! These many years have I served you. Nor have I ever transgressed your commands, yet never have you given me a goat, so that I might be merry with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this son of yours came, who has devoured your living with harlots, you killed the fattened calf for him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was fitting to be merry and be glad, for this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told His disciples: “There was a rich man who had a steward who was accused to the man of wasting his resources.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called him and said, ‘How is it that I hear this about you? Give an account of your stewardship, for you may no longer be steward.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the steward said to himself, ‘What shall I do, for my master is taking away the stewardship from me? I cannot dig. I am ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what to do so that, when I am removed from the stewardship, others may receive me into their houses.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he called each of his master’s debtors, and said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He said, ‘Eight hundred gallons of oil.’
“He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write four hundred.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’
“He said, ‘One thousand bushels of wheat.’
“He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eight hundred.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The master commended the dishonest steward, because he had acted prudently. For the sons of this world are wiser in their own generation than the sons of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, make friends for yourself by means of unrighteous wealth, so that when you fall short, they may receive you into eternal dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who is faithful in what is least is faithful also in much. And he who is dishonest in the least is dishonest also in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you have not been faithful in the unrighteous wealth, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who will give you that which is your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No servant can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things and derided Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is highly esteemed before men is an abomination before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Law and the Prophets were preached until John. Since then the kingdom of God has been preached, and everyone is pressing into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one stroke of the law to fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery, and whoever marries her who is divorced by her husband commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and fared sumptuously every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores, who had been placed at his gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: desiring to be fed the crumbs falling from the rich man’s table. Moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It came to pass that the beggar died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s presence. The rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Hades, being in torment, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham from a distance and Lazarus in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he cried out, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue. For I am tormented in this flame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you in your lifetime received your good things, and Lazarus in like manner evil things. But now he is comforted and you are tormented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf, so that those who would pass from here to you cannot, nor can those from there pass to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said, ‘Then I pray you, father, to send him to my father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have five brothers, to testify to them, lest they also come to this place of torment.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them hear them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham. But if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘If they do not hear Moses and the Prophets, neither will they be persuaded if someone should rise from the dead.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the disciples, “It is impossible except that offenses will come. But woe to him through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he was thrown into the sea, than to offend one of these little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take heed to yourselves.
“If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. And if he repents, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turns to you, saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If you had faith as a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which of you, having a servant plowing or herding sheep, will say to him when he has come in from the field, ‘Come now and sit down for dinner’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he not rather say to him, ‘Prepare my supper, and dress yourself and serve me until I eat and drink. And afterward you will eat and drink’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does he thank the servant because he did what was commanded? I think not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you also, when you have done everything commanded you, say, ‘We are unprofitable servants. We have done our duty.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus went to Jerusalem, He passed between Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He entered a village, there met Him ten men who were lepers, who stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have pity on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He saw them, He said to them, “Go, show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went, they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, returned with a loud voice glorifying God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks. And he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Were not the ten cleansed? Where are the nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were there not any found to return and give glory to God except this foreigner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to him, “Rise, go your way. Your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, He answered them, “The kingdom of God does not come with observation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor will they say, ‘Here it is!’ or ‘There it is!’ For remember, the kingdom of God is within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will say to you, ‘Look here,’ or ‘Look there!’ Do not follow after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning flashes and lights up the heavens from one side to the other, so will the Son of Man be in His day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Just as it was in the days of Noah, so will it be in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were eating, drinking, marrying, and were given in marriage until the day when Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Likewise as it was in the days of Lot: They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the day that Lot departed from Sodom, fire and brimstone rained from heaven and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So will it be on the day when the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day let him who is on the housetop, with his goods in the house, not come down to take them away. And likewise let him who is in the field not return to the things behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever seeks to save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, on that night two men will be in one bed; the one will be taken and the other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding grain together; the one will be taken and the other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two men will be in the field; the one will be taken and the other will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, “Where, Lord?”
He replied, “Where the body is, there the eagles will be gathered together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them a parable to illustrate that it is necessary always to pray and not lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said: “In a city there was a judge who did not fear God or regard man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a widow was in that city. She came to him, saying, ‘Avenge me against my adversary.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He would not for a while. Yet afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I do not fear God or respect man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow troubles me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she will weary me.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Hear what the unjust judge says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall not God avenge His own elect and be patient with them, who cry day and night to Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, He will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told this parable to some who trusted in themselves, as though they were righteous, and despised others:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, the one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed these things about himself, ‘God, I thank You that I am not like other men: extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week, and I tithe of all that I earn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the tax collector, standing at a distance, would not even lift his eyes to heaven, but struck his chest, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me a sinner.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also brought infants to Him that He might touch them. When the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to Him and said, “Permit the little children to come to Me, and do not hinder them. For to such belongs the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly, I say to you, whoever will not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will in no wise enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain ruler asked Him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good, except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honor your father and your mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “All these I have kept since my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, He said to him, “Yet you lack one thing. Sell all that you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come, follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard this he became very sorrowful, for he was very rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that he became very sorrowful, He said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard this said, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What is impossible with men is possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Look, we have left everything and followed You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Truly, I tell you, there is no man who has left his home or parents or brothers or wife or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall not receive many times more in this age and, in the age to come, eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking the twelve, He said, “Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be accomplished,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for He will be handed over to the Gentiles and will be mocked and insulted and spit upon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will scourge Him and put Him to death, and on the third day He will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they did not comprehend what was spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He was drawing near Jericho, a certain blind man sat along the way begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearing a crowd passing by, he asked what it meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who went in front rebuked him, so that he would keep quiet. But he cried out much more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stood and commanded him to be brought to Him. When he came near, He asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want Me to do for you?”
He said, “Lord, grant that I may receive my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has saved you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he received his sight and followed Him, glorifying God. When all the people saw it, they gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man was there named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He tried to see who Jesus was, but was not able from the crowd, because he was little in stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, for He was to pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the vicinity, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must remain at your house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he hurried and came down, and received Him joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, “He has gone to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, I give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have taken anything from anyone by false accusation, I will repay him four times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they heard these things, He continued and told them a parable, because He was near Jerusalem and because they thought the kingdom of God would immediately appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He said, “A nobleman went to a distant country to receive a kingdom and to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called his ten servants and entrusted to them ten pounds and said to them, ‘Trade until I come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he returned, having received the kingdom, he summoned these servants, to whom he had entrusted the money, that he might know what everyone gained by trading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The first came, saying, ‘Master, your pound has made ten pounds more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, good servant! Because you have been faithful in very little, take authority over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second came, saying, ‘Master, your pound has made five pounds more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said in like manner to him, ‘You, take authority over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then another came, saying, ‘Master, look, here is your pound, which I have kept put away in a napkin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You collect what you did not deposit, and reap what you did not sow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant. You knew that I was an exacting man, collecting what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then did you not deposit my money in the bank, so that at my coming I might have collected it with interest?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he said to those who stood by, ‘Take the pound from him and give it to him who has ten pounds.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They said to him, ‘Master, he has ten pounds.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘I tell you that to everyone who has will be given. But from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for those enemies of mine, who would not let me reign over them, bring them here and slay them before me.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He went before them, ascending up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mountain called the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Go over into the village opposite you, where, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever yet sat. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you shall say to him, ‘Because the Lord has need of it.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were sent went and found it just as He had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “The Lord has need of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought it to Jesus. And they threw their garments on the colt, and they set Jesus on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He went, they spread their clothes in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was coming near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with loud voices for all the mighty works that they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying:
‘Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord!’
Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I tell you, if these should be silent, the stones would immediately cry out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came near, He beheld the city and wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you, even you, had known even today what things would bring you peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment around you and surround you, and press you in on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will dash you, and your children within you, to the ground. They will not leave one stone upon another within you, because you did not know the time of your visitation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He entered the temple and began to drive out those who sold and bought in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be a house of prayer,’ but you have made it ‘a den of thieves.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people tried to kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they could not find a way to do it, for all the people were very attentive to hear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, as He taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes with the elders came up to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Him, “Tell us, by what authority are You doing these things? Who is he who gave You this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I will also ask you one thing. Answer Me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They debated with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they answered that they did not know where it was from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, and leased it to vinedressers, and went to a distant country for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At harvest time he sent a servant to the vinedressers so they might give him some fruit of the vineyard. But the vinedressers beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent another servant. But they beat him also, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again, he sent a third. And they wounded him also and drove him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. Perhaps they will respect him when they see him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the vinedressers saw him, they debated among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they drove him out of the vineyard and killed him.
“What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will come and kill these vinedressers and will give the vineyard to others.”
When they heard this, they said, “May it not be so!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looked at them and said, “What then is this that is written:
‘The stone which the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever falls on that stone will be broken. But he on whom it falls will be crushed to powder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes tried to lay their hands on Him that same hour, but they feared the people. For they perceived that He had told this parable against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched Him and sent out spies who pretended to be righteous men, that they might seize Him in His words to hand Him over to the power and authority of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked Him, “Teacher, we know that You speak and teach rightly. And You do not show partiality, but You truly teach the way of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He perceived their craftiness and said to them, “Why do you test Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show Me a denarius. Whose image and inscription does it have?”
They said, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then render to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They could not catch Him in His words before the people. And they marveled at His answer and were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is any resurrection, came to Him and asked Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies, having a wife but no children, then this man should take the wife and raise up children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife and died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then the third took her, and in like manner, all seven died and left no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last of all, the woman died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who are counted worthy to attain that age, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they cannot die any more, for they are equal to the angels and are the sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, at the bush, even Moses pointed out that the dead are raised when he called the Lord ‘the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. For to Him all live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the scribes said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that they dared not ask Him any question at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “How do they say that Christ is David’s Son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself says in the Book of Psalms,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at My right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I make Your enemies
    Your footstool.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David therefore calls Him ‘Lord.’ How is He then his Son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then as all the people heard, He said to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the scribes who desire to walk in long robes and who love greetings in the marketplaces and the prominent seats in the synagogues and the seats of honor at banquets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour widows’ houses and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts in the treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also saw a poor widow putting in two mites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put in more than all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all these out of their abundance have put in their gifts for God. But she out of her poverty has put in all the living she had.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As some spoke of how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and gifts, He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things which you see, the days will come when not one stone shall be left on another that will not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked Him, “Teacher, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when this is about to happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Beware lest you be deceived. For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and ‘The time has drawn near.’ Therefore do not go after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear of wars and commotions, do not be afraid. For these things must first take place, but the end will not be at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great earthquakes will occur in various places, and there will be famines and pestilence. And there will be terrors and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But before all these things, they will seize you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors for My name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will turn out as a testimony for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore resolve in your hearts beforehand not to practice your defense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your opponents will be able to neither refute nor resist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be betrayed by parents and brothers and relatives and friends. And they will put some of you to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for My name’s sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but not a hair of your head shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your endurance you will gain your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then you know that its desolation has drawn near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, and let those who are in the city depart, and let not those who are in the country enter it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse in those days! For there will be great distress in the land and wrath upon this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword and will be led away captive to all nations. And Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be signs in the sun and the moon and the stars; and on the earth distress of nations, with perplexity, the sea and the waves roaring;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men fainting from fear and expectation of what is coming on the inhabited earth. For the powers of heaven will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When these things begin to happen, look up and lift up your heads, for your redemption is drawing near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them this parable: “Look at the fig tree, and all the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they are sprouting leaves already, you see and know for yourselves that summer is now near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in like manner, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly, I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts become burdened by excessiveness and drunkenness and anxieties of life, and that Day comes on you unexpectedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as a snare it will come on all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore watch always and pray that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each day He was teaching in the temple, and each night He went out and stayed on the mountain called the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people came early in the morning to hear Him in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, drew near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and scribes were seeking how to kill Jesus, for they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan entered into Judas, called Iscariot, who was one of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and discussed with the chief priests and captains how he might betray Him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were glad and agreed to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fully consented and searched for an opportunity to betray Him to them apart from the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Day of Unleavened Bread came, when the Passover lamb must be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us to eat it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Where will You have us prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Now, as you enter the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you there. Follow him into the house which he enters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show you a large furnished upper room. Prepare there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and found it as He had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the hour had come, He and the twelve apostles with Him sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, I will never eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took the cup and gave thanks and said, “Take this and divide it among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He took the bread, and when He had given thanks, He broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In like manner, He took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood which is shed for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But see the hand of him who betrays Me is with Me at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the Son of Man goes as it has been determined. But woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to inquire among themselves which of them it was who would do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also rivalry among them concerning which of them was to be counted the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them, and those who exercise authority over them are called benefactors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not so. Instead, let him who is greatest among you be as the younger, and he who rules as he who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is greater: he who sits at the table, or he who serves? Is it not he who sits at the table? But I am among you as He who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are those who have continued with Me in My trials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I appoint to you a kingdom as My Father has appointed one to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Simon, Simon, listen! Satan has demanded to have you to sift you as wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have prayed for you that your faith may not fail. And when you have repented, strengthen your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with You to prison and to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He said to them, “When I sent you without purse or bag or sandals, did you lack anything?”
They said, “Nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But now, let him who has a purse take it and also a bag. And let him who has no sword sell his garment and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, what is written must yet be accomplished in Me, ‘And He was numbered with the transgressors.’ Indeed, what is written concerning Me has a fulfillment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said, “Lord, look, here are two swords.”
He said to them, “It is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to His custom, He came out and went to the Mount of Olives. And His disciples followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came there, He said to them, “Pray that you may not fall into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, and He knelt down and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, if You are willing, remove this cup from Me. Nevertheless not My will, but Yours, be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being in anguish, He prayed more earnestly. And His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He rose from prayer and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray, lest you fall into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was yet speaking, a crowd came. And he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He drew near to Jesus to kiss Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who were around Him saw what would follow, they said, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “This is enough!” And He touched his ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, and captains of the temple guard, and the elders who had come for Him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs as against a rebel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Daily, while I was with you in the temple, you did not lay hands on Me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they arrested Him, and led Him away, and brought Him into the high priest’s house. Peter followed at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a servant girl saw him as he sat near the fire, and gazed at him, and said, “This man was with Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little later someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them.”
Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About an hour later another man firmly declared, “Certainly, this man also was with Him, for he is a Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying.” Immediately, while he was yet speaking, the rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had told him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter went outside and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who guarded Jesus mocked Him and whipped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face and asked Him, “Prophesy! Who struck You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many other things they blasphemously spoke against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When day came, the assembly of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and scribes, came together and led Him away to their council, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Are You the Christ? Tell us!”
He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I also question you, you will not answer Me or release Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all said, “Are You then the Son of God?”
He said to them, “You truly say that I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “What further testimony do we need? We have heard it from His own mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole assembly rose and led Him to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this Man perverting our nation, and forbidding us to pay taxes to Caesar, and saying that He Himself is Christ a King.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
He answered, “You truly say so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and to the people, “I find no fault in this Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the Man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned that He belonged to Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod saw Jesus, he greatly rejoiced, for he had desired to see Him for a long time, because he had heard many things of Him, and he was hoping to see some miracle performed by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He questioned Him with many words, but He gave no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes stood by, vehemently accusing Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod with his soldiers despised Him, and mocked Him, and dressed Him in a fine robe, and sent Him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same day Pilate and Herod became friends with each other, having previously been at enmity with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You have brought this Man to me as one who incites the people. And truly, I, having examined Him before you, have found no fault in this Man concerning those things of which you accuse Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us. Look, nothing worthy of death has been done by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will therefore chastise Him and release Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was obligated to release one man to them at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all cried out at once saying, “Take this Man away and release Barabbas to us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man had been thrown in prison for an insurrection in the city and for murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Pilate spoke to them again, desiring to release Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they cried out, “Crucify Him! Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them a third time, “Why, what evil has He done? I have found in Him no cause worthy of death. I will therefore chastise Him and release Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they insisted with loud voices, asking that He be crucified. And the voices of these men and of the chief priests prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate gave the sentence as they demanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He released to them the man who was thrown in prison for insurrection and murder, whom they asked for. But he sentenced Jesus according to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator
