verses.text: As they led Him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming from the country, and they laid the cross on him to carry it behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large number of people followed Him, including women who mourned and lamented Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned to them, saying, “Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, the days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, who never bore and never nursed!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then
they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us,’
    and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if men do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two different men, who were criminals, also were led with Him to be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the place which is called The Skull, there they crucified Him and the criminals, one on the right and one on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” And they divided His clothes by casting lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood by watching. But the rulers with them scoffed, saying, “He saved others. Let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the Chosen One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the soldiers also mocked Him, coming to Him and offering Him sour wine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inscription was written over Him in letters of Greek and Latin and Hebrew:
THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the criminals who were hanged blasphemed Him, saying, “If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other rebuked him, saying, “Do you not fear God, seeing you are under the same sentence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we indeed, justly. For we are receiving the due reward of our deeds. But this Man has done nothing amiss.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when You come into Your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Truly, I tell you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over all the land until the ninth hour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the sun was darkened. And the veil of the temple was torn in the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I commit My spirit.” Having said this, He gave up the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God and said, “Certainly, this was a righteous Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the crowds who came together to that sight, witnessing what occurred, struck their chests and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all those who knew Him and the women accompanying Him from Galilee stood at a distance, seeing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, who was a good and just man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had not consented to their counsel and deed. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, and he himself was also waiting for the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took Him down, and wrapped Him in linen, and placed Him in a hewn tomb, where no one had ever been buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the Day of Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who came with Him from Galilee followed, and saw the tomb and how His body was placed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain other women with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were greatly perplexed concerning this, suddenly two men stood by them in shining garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were afraid and bowed their faces to the ground, they said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but has risen! Remember how He spoke to you while He was still in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they remembered His words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they returned from the tomb and reported all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Mary Magdalene and Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and other women with them, who told these things to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their words seemed like fables to them, and they did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter rose and ran to the tomb. Stooping down, he saw the linen clothes lying by themselves. He departed, wondering in himself what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were talking with each other about all these things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they communed and reasoned together, Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What kind of communication are you sharing with one another while you are walking and are sad?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, named Cleopas, answered Him, “Are You the only foreigner in Jerusalem who does not know what has happened there in these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “What things?”
They said to Him, “Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet, powerful in deed and word before God and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how our chief priests and rulers handed Him over to be sentenced to death and crucified Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we were hoping that it was He who was to redeem Israel. Moreover, today is the third day since these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even some women from among us, who arrived early at the tomb, surprised us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find His body, they returned saying that they had even seen a vision of angels, who said that He was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said. But they did not see Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “O fools! And slow of heart to believe what the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was it not necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and to enter His glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, He explained to them the things concerning Himself in all the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drew near the village where they were traveling, and He seemed to be going farther.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us. For it is nearly evening and the day is far spent.” So He went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He sat at supper with them, He took the bread, blessed it and broke it, and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their eyes were opened, and they recognized Him. And He vanished out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Did not our hearts burn within us while He talked to us on the way and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose up and returned to Jerusalem at once. And they found the eleven and those who were with them assembled together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Lord has risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they reported what had happened on the way, and how He was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were saying this, Jesus Himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace be unto you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were terrified and frightened, and supposed that they saw a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you troubled, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Feel Me and see. For a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they yet disbelieved for joy and wondered, He said to them, “Do you have any food here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave Him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took it and ate it before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and in the Prophets and in the Psalms concerning Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Thus it is written, and accordingly it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And look, I am sending the promise of My Father upon you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He blessed them, He parted from them and was carried up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they worshipped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
